Author: regnar#0000
Content: Do we like "Komodo Consensus # dPoW"  ?

Author: jl777#0000
Content: it is a question for Steve

Author: regnar#0000
Content: not as a name change obviously, but as a simple way of describing the function of dPoW as a notary service that involves consensus on what the notarized hash says. <@U6ZES59AA>

Author: regnar#0000
Content: bleh, its early, not sure if that came out right

Author: jl777#0000
Content: I only made a very small change to satoshi consensus rules, not sure it deserves its own consensus label. It even uses the same checkpointing process the normal inside the sourcecode checkpointing does, just dynamically, every 10 minutes

Author: jl777#0000
Content: but I have seen a lot of FUD about checkpointing being centralized...

Author: jl777#0000
Content: I dont really care what it is marketed as

Author: regnar#0000
Content: yea that is a tricky part, "64 nodes?! that's not decentralized" says the bitcoin and XRP bag holder

Author: regnar#0000
Content: but there are still miners in KMD

Author: regnar#0000
Content: well see what Steve thinks about it, I know Hansen, Fishy, Mylo and a few others were discussing it earlier today

Author: jl777#0000
Content: 64 nodes running the same notarization dapp

Author: jl777#0000
Content: and the notaries will be the first to admit it is quite random which 13 notaries are selected for each round

Author: jl777#0000
Content: and 64 might be small compared to BTC but for a lot of the small coins that is almost as many as their entire mining set of mining nodes

Author: jl777#0000
Content: also BTC mining pools are much less than 64 to get majority hashrate

Author: jl777#0000
Content: before complaining about the centralization of another project, maybe best to make sure 6 mining pools dont control the majority of your hashrate

Author: jusoaresf#0000
Content: yes indeed!

Author: jl777#0000
Content: and before the maximalist retorts that each pool represents potentially thousands of different miners, I ask them, which of those thousands of miners controls the blocktemplate that is being mined?

Author: jl777#0000
Content: any of the thousand miners or the pool operator?

Author: regnar#0000
Content: yep, this similar problem came up earlier. the comparison may not be fair, but it will be made. so we just best prepare ourselves for an answer

Author: jl777#0000
Content: if it is the pool operator, then doesnt that mean that 6 people control the BTC majority hashrate?

Author: jl777#0000
Content: and they would complain about our 64 notaries?

Author: regnar#0000
Content: like atomic swap DEX vs CEX for trade times...

Author: jl777#0000
Content: I chose 64 for a reason

Author: regnar#0000
Content: which is?

Author: regnar#0000
Content: I don't think I know this one haha

Author: jl777#0000
Content: it is a big enough number to be impractical to easily dominate

Author: jl777#0000
Content: yet it isnt so large that a N*N fully connected network wont explode with traffic

Author: jl777#0000
Content: so having 256 notaries is not only impractical from an elections standpoint as I doubt three are even 256 people who have the skills to be notaries, it dilutes notary rewards 8fold and increases network traffic 16 fold

Author: jl777#0000
Content: and still the maximalists would say that "only 256 notaries" is centralized

Author: regnar#0000
Content: It sounds like you recently got into a debate with a maximalist haha

Author: regnar#0000
Content: I don't often hear "Notary nodes are centralized"

Author: jl777#0000
Content: maximalists used to be a real annoyance back when BTC dominance was 90%, nowadays most are much more realistic, even if their rhetoric doesnt reflect it

Author: jl777#0000
Content: and dont get me wrong, BTC's network effect will ensure it will be here long term and KMD notarizes to BTC for a good reason. I am not against BTC in any way

Author: jl777#0000
Content: its just that some maximalists sound like fiat officials saying BTC is backed by nothing, as if all the fiat paper is

Author: regnar#0000
Content: value is subjective anyway, being backed by something doesn't matter if that something is worthless to me. *coughCough Toxic Mortgage backed Securities Cough*cough

Author: regnar#0000
Content: okay any marketing people, do we have a focus for the types of ERC20 tokens we want first? we looking for social media coins, industry/utility coins, altruism projects ?

Author: imylomylo#0000
Content: hmmmm there goes exponential maths...4000+ connections between nodes is impressive

Author: regnar#0000
Content: I'm kinda targeting Mithril MITH (decentralized social media platform), LIFElabs LIFE (1/3rd total supply is ringfenced for philanthropic causes, worldwide), Republic Protocol REN (decentralized dark pool for trustless cross-chain atomic trading of Ether, ERC20 tokens and Bitcoin pairs.) and DENT (Tokenizing the Mobile Data Industry to sell and buy Mobile Data with DENT Tokens)

Author: regnar#0000
Content: Obviously all long term and assuming we were to convert them, that's my thoughts

Author: regnar#0000
Content: I figured this gives us a pretty rounded erc20 conversion, if we can get them interested. They aren't each the Biggest chains, but more like SME. Mithril social media platform could help KMD and the asset chains by giving them better exposure, LIFE is philanthropic and from their twitter actually gives back money, REN is basically trying to make a "dark pool" version of BarterDEX which they could likely use the BarterDEX engine with tweaks if they are with Komodo, and DENT is just a cool project that is probably going to be seriously hurt by ETH gas prices in the future and could bring some more uniqueness.

Author: regnar#0000
Content: Also up for discussion, does "Asset chain" convey the same feeling as "independent chain" or some other variant?

Author: regnar#0000
Content: If you were an ETH token, it might sound more appealing to migrate if you weren't an asset chain, or something like that, it might come off as you are dependent on KMD. There might be a better way to describe Asset chains that is unique in crypto but still conveys independence, security, and freedom... I'll think on it today.

Author: jl777#0000

Author: jl777#0000

Author: n2okpride#0000
Content: <@U4X7GDWT0> in the past we've labeled dpow as Komodo Security Services as an alternate to just dPoW. We can position it as an additional security layer to provide protection. We can also reference the analogy James used with 2FA, as it is an additional layer of security, but not 100% guaranteed protection.

Author: n2okpride#0000
Content: i think parallel chain still works from a technical standpoint, and as a means to differentiate from side chains.

Author: n2okpride#0000
Content: question is if we want to classify it as a technical marketing term - parallel chain vs side vs child

Author: n2okpride#0000
Content: or go further to brand it something like Scale Chain, Cluster Chain, Link Chain, etc, etc
